title: Technical Lead - Fullstack Developer
subTitle: *11 years* of experience
name: Alexandre Hebert
description:
Passionate computer scientist, more precisely *full stack developer*, and with extensive experience in *agile methodologies*, I put my skills at the service of startups or multinationals, in *varied business fields* during more than *ten years*.

I had the chance to join talented teams, following or not principles of so-called agile methodologies. I’ve worn *several hats* from lead developer to Scrum master in parallel to my development activities, and even CTO for a short period. But more than my solid experiences and development skills, I am *adaptable* and I’m always *striving to do better*.

Plus, I like to bring *good vibes* and *best practices* (tests, continuous integration, etc.) wherever I go, wherever I work!

experiences.description: As a technical lead, I guided the development team in modernizing the loan platform.
contributions: design and contribution to the development of a check specimen reading service
design of the call recording retrieval and playback service
design and development of the new merchant onboarding service
migration of a React component library to Vite

experiences.description: In the context of a product launch, I contributed to the development of the site allowing the very first orders to be taken. I also bootstrapped a back office to manage new customers, their orders or even the installation of their system.
contributions: development of the back-office for customer service and internal staff
implementation of logistics batch jobs for parcel shipping
design of the marketing website and implementation of the design system, including landing page and shopping cart
implementation of synchronization webhooks with the payment service
development of the invoice generation service
development of the transactional email sending service

experiences.shortDescription: (now Salsify) a data aggregator for retail companies
experiences.description: During the merge with Salsify, I developed a brand new permissions management interface for clients, allowing them to finely choose "who" can modify which product, and how. I then had to develop the modification history, in order to make the screens and dashboard more intuitive and fluid.
contributions: modification of the product data read/write interface
development of the product data change history interface
development of the customer administration interface
development of the permissions module interface

experiences.description: While Qare was an outsider, I contributed to the development of their patient management interface. Subsequently, I was able to participate in the development of the online appointment booking interface, in order to convince more doctors to use the solution.
contributions: development of the patient management interface
modification of the online appointment booking module
modification of the prescription generation service

experiences.description: After a successful fundraising, Virtuo was able to offer me the opportunity to develop back-office building blocks and more particularly the management of damages related to their two thousand vehicles in order to optimize the costs linked to damages. I also developed integration with third-party rental sites, making Virtuo more visible and helping to increase bookings.
contributions: development of the vehicle damage management interface
integration with third-party car rental platforms
enhancements to the vehicle reservation website
enhancements to the website dedicated to business customers
modification of the transactional email sending service

experiences.description: In a context of Frichti's expansion to several French cities, I mainly developed their delivery planning in order to manage a fleet of hundreds of delivery people, and the synchronization of customer data with various marketing tools in order to better identify and target their thousands of customers.
contributions: development of the delivery planning system integrated with Shiftplan
modification of the backend application for delivery drivers
development of synchronization batch jobs with Segment
various enhancements to the existing website

experiences.description: In a market where technical profiles are hard to find, I contributed to the development of a technical profile scoring tool capable of measuring the propensity of the latter to leave their current job, or not. I also developed a Chrome extension allowing the recruiter to save time and access the data and scoring of a profile from any LinkedIn page.
contributions: development of a Chrome extension for LinkedIn
creation of the recruitment process management dashboard
creation of the candidate pool database

experiences.description: While Canal Plus was about to announce the launch of their brand new TV decoder, I participated in the development of the decoder interface, from the presentation and selection of channels, to the communication interface with the lower bricks of the decoder. The objective is to stand out from competitors by offering an intuitive, pleasing to the eye, and fluid interface.
contributions: modification of the virtual on-screen keyboard
development of the channel selection interface
modification of the playback overlay
implementation of communication with external channel providers

experiences.description: In order to optimize and reduce the risks linked to its fleet of 700,000 vehicles, I developed the vehicle fleet management interface, the presentation of consolidated data in the form of diagrams, as well as communication with 700,000 vehicles.
contributions: development of the customer vehicle fleet management dashboard
design of detailed trip views for each vehicle
development of consolidated data charts for fuel consumption, driver behavior, and more

contributions: development of the meter reading point management portal
integration of the new portal with the existing system
optimization of various database queries using caching (L2)
